ai-thag4.11:1.1_0: When the crane with its beautiful white wings,
ai-thag4.11:1.2_0: I’m tangled by fear of drivers.
ai-thag4.11:1.4_0: But the river Bāhuka enjoyed me.
ai-thag4.11:2.1_0: When the crane, so pure and white,
ai-thag4.11:2.2_0: I’m tangled by fear of drivers.
ai-thag4.11:2.3_0: seeks a cave to shelter in, but can’t see one—
ai-thag4.11:2.4_0: But the river Bāhuka enjoyed me.
ai-thag4.11:3.3_0: that adorn both banks of the river,
ai-thag4.11:4.1_0: Rid of snakes, that death-mad swarm,
ai-thag4.11:4.3_0: “Today isn’t the time to stray from mountain streams;
ai-thag4.11:4.4_0: Ajakaraṇī is safe, pleasant, and delightful.”
